intro: Lantana achyranthifolia, commonly known as the silver lantana, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, which bloom throughout the year in many climates. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a silvery or grayish underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lantana achyranthifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
